qas.question: What war is considered to be the last Roman pacification in Northern Africa?
What eventually caused Jugurtha to become a captive?
When did the Jugurthine War end?
Who attempted to usurp the throne of Numidia?
Who did Jugurtha have to bribe in order for them to accept him as the new leader of Numidia?

context: <a0_0>The Jugurthine War<a0_0/> of 111–<a2_0>104 BC<a2_0/> was fought between Rome and Jugurtha of the North African kingdom of Numidia. It constituted the final Roman pacification of Northern Africa, after which Rome largely ceased expansion on the continent after reaching natural barriers of desert and mountain. Following Jugurtha's usurpation of the throne of Numidia, a loyal ally of Rome since the Punic Wars, Rome felt compelled to intervene. <a3_0>Jugurtha<a3_0/> impudently bribed <a4_0>the Romans<a4_0/> into accepting his usurpation. Jugurtha was finally captured not in battle but by <a1_0>treachery<a1_0/>.
